GwtGrailsPlugin

GwtGrailsPlugin()

 
Method Detail

checkTypeArg

public def checkTypeArg(def type, def ann)
Checks whether a TypeArg annotation matches the given type. If it doesn't, an exception is thrown.
param:
type (Class) The type to check the annotation against. Should either implement Collection or Map.
param:
ann (Annotation) The TypeArg annotation to check.

endTypeArgComment

public def endTypeArgComment(def output)
' } /** Writes the end of a javadoc comment to the given output.

findModules

public def findModules(def searchDir)
Searches a given directory for any GWT module files, and returns a list of their fully-qualified names.
param:
searchDir A string path specifying the directory to search in.
return:
a list of fully-qualified module names.

generateClientInterfaces

public def generateClientInterfaces(def serviceWrapper, def packageName, def log)
Creates the required service and async interfaces for a given Grails service. This checks to make sure that neither interface file has been modified since they were last generated. If either has, then the generation is skipped - we don't want to overwrite user changes.
param:
serviceWrapper (GrailsClass) The Grails service's class.
param:
packageName (String) The GWT client package in which to put the interfaces.
param:
log The plugin logger.

getPackage

public def getPackage(def serviceWrapper)
Determines whether the given service has been configured for GWT RPC, and if so returns the package in which the corresponding interfaces should be generated.
param:
serviceWrapper (GrailsClass) The Grails service to query.
return:
The fully-qualified name of the package in which to put the generated interfaces.

getType

public def getType(def clazz)
Returns the string representation of the given type. For example, 'java.lang.String', 'int', 'java.lang.String[]', 'boolean[][][]'.

handleTypeArg

public def handleTypeArg(def output, def method)
Checks for any TypeArg annotations on a given method and writes the appropriate javadoc with '@gwt.typeArgs' tags if necessary.
param:
output (output stream, string buffer) The stream or buffer to write the javadoc to. The only requirement is that is supports the '<<' operator.
param:
method (Method) The method definition to process.

startTypeArgComment

public def startTypeArgComment(def output)
Writes the start of a javadoc comment to the given output.

writeTypeArgEntry

public def writeTypeArgEntry(def output, def ann, def paramName)
Writes a '@gwt.typeArgs' javadoc entry for the given annotation and parameter name.
param:
output (stream, buffer) The output to write the entry to. The only requirement is that it implements the '<<' operator.
param:
ann (Annotation) The TypeArg annotation to generate the GWT javadoc tag for.
param:
paramName (String) The parameter name as specified in the corresponding method signature. Use null if the tag corresponds to a return type.
